ID: CXZTJOB_00
From: Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com>
To: Mohammed El Neel <Mohammed.Elneel@chalhoub.com>; Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
CC: Sara Rebeiz <Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com>; Alexandre Cachecho <Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com>
BCC: 
Date: 2025-05-12 10:20
Subject: Level Shoes Al Quoz Warehouse 
--------------------------------------------------
Hi Mohammed, Hi Hagop

 

Trust all is well. 

 

We wanted to confirm whether the Allied Enterprises LLC trade license—or any other relevant document—explicitly includes the operation of a warehouse or similar activity as one of its licensed activities, particularly given that it currently operates the Level Shoes Warehouse in Al Quoz. Would this activity fall under any of the categories currently listed?

 

@Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  further to our discussion on TEAMS, we would like to better understand the scope of our insurance coverage (attached for reference). Could you confirm whether the policy limits extend to products stored in the warehouse, even though they are held on a concession basis (i.e., we are storing but do not own the products and only receive a commission once they are sold)?

 

Additionally, before onboarding certain brands’ products into the warehouse in light of the above model, do we need to request specific insurance coverage or a policy from them?

From: Dana Mahdi
Sent: Monday, May 12, 2025 10:19:55 AM
To: Mohammed El Neel <Mohammed.Elneel@chalhoub.com>; Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
Cc: Sara Rebeiz <Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com>; Alexandre Cachecho <Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com>
Subject: Level Shoes Al Quoz Warehouse 
 

Hi Mohammed, Hi Hagop

 

Trust all is well. 

 

We wanted to confirm whether the Allied Enterprises LLC trade license—or any other relevant document—explicitly includes the operation of a warehouse or similar activity as one of its licensed activities, particularly given that it currently operates the Level Shoes Warehouse in Al Quoz. Would this activity fall under any of the categories currently listed?

 

@Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  further to our discussion on TEAMS, we would like to better understand the scope of our insurance coverage (attached for reference). Could you confirm whether the policy limits extend to products stored in the warehouse, even though they are held on a concession basis (i.e., we are storing but do not own the products and only receive a commission once they are sold)?

 

Additionally, before onboarding certain brands’ products into the warehouse in light of the above model, do we need to request specific insurance coverage or a policy from them?

 

@Alexandre Cachecho <mailto:Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com>  for additional information if needed. 

 

Let us know your feedback at the earliest. 

 

Best, 

Dana

chunks.text:

@Alexandre Cachecho <mailto:Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com>  for additional information if needed.

Best, 

Dana

 


--------------------------------------------------
ID: CXZTJOB_03
From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
To: Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com>; Mohammed El Neel <Mohammed.Elneel@chalhoub.com>
CC: Sara Rebeiz <Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com>; Alexandre Cachecho <Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com>
BCC: 
Date: 2025-05-22 15:43
Subject: Re: Level Shoes Al Quoz Warehouse 
--------------------------------------------------
Hi Dana,

We can cover stock held in consignment but we need to declare the stock value and pay the relevant premium.

Also, the contract with the consignor, we need to have it mentioned that we are responsible for losses to the products whilst in our possession and the basis of compensation as the insurance will follow the underlying contract when settling the claim.


The framework is in place that we can cover goods in trust. However, in order to do so, we need to declare the value of stock held in trust and pay additional premium.

Let me know if you need any further information.

Best Regards,
Hagop

________________________________

--------------------------------------------------
ID: CXZTJOB_04
From: Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com>
To: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>; Alexandre Cachecho <Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com>
CC: Sara Rebeiz <Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com>; Mohammed El Neel <Mohammed.Elneel@chalhoub.com>
BCC: 
Date: 2025-05-22 16:10
Subject: RE: Level Shoes Al Quoz Warehouse 
--------------------------------------------------
Hi Hagop, 

 

Thanks for the breakdown. 

 

For context, this is our standard concession agreement, and the insurance terms are outlined on page 17. If the brand accepts this concession agreement with those insurance terms as-is, are we sufficiently covered? Or would we need to incorporate additional language to address the below—specifically that the goods are held in trust and premium has been paid? How long would this take with the insurer?

 

Also, is there a way to pass this premium cost back to the brand, either by including it as a reimbursable expense in the concession agreement or by charging a warehousing/service fee that covers the insurance?

 

@Alexandre Cachecho <mailto:Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com>  are you OK with Hagop’s feedback?

 

Best, 

Dana

Best, 

Dana

From: Dana Mahdi
Sent: Monday, May 12, 2025 10:19:55 AM
To: Mohammed El Neel <Mohammed.Elneel@chalhoub.com <mailto:Mohammed.Elneel@chalhoub.com> >; Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Sara Rebeiz <Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com <mailto:Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com> >; Alexandre Cachecho <Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com <mailto:Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: Level Shoes Al Quoz Warehouse 

 

Hi Mohammed, Hi Hagop

 

Trust all is well.

 

We wanted to confirm whether the Allied Enterprises LLC trade license—or any other relevant document—explicitly includes the operation of a warehouse or similar activity as one of its licensed activities, particularly given that it currently operates the Level Shoes Warehouse in Al Quoz. Would this activity fall under any of the categories currently listed?

 

@Hagop Ghazarian <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>  further to our discussion on TEAMS, we would like to better understand the scope of our insurance coverage (attached for reference). Could you confirm whether the policy limits extend to products stored in the warehouse, even though they are held on a concession basis (i.e., we are storing but do not own the products and only receive a commission once they are sold)?

 

Additionally, before onboarding certain brands’ products into the warehouse in light of the above model, do we need to request specific insurance coverage or a policy from them?

 

@Alexandre Cachecho <mailto:Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com>  for additional information if needed.

metadata.doc_id: CXZTJOB - level shoes al quoz warehouse\Conversation.txt

@Alexandre Cachecho <mailto:Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com>  for additional information if needed.

 

Let us know your feedback at the earliest.

 

Best,

Dana

chunks.text:
From: Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com>
Sent: Thursday, May 22, 2025 4:09 PM
To: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>; Alexandre Cachecho <Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com>
Cc: Sara Rebeiz <Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com>; Mohammed El Neel <Mohammed.Elneel@chalhoub.com>
Subject: RE: Level Shoes Al Quoz Warehouse 
 

Hi Hagop,

 

Thanks for the breakdown.

 

For context, this is our standard concession agreement, and the insurance terms are outlined on page 17. If the brand accepts this concession agreement with those insurance terms as-is, are we sufficiently covered? Or would we need to incorporate additional language to address the below—specifically that the goods are held in trust and premium has been paid? How long would this take with the insurer?

 

Also, is there a way to pass this premium cost back to the brand, either by including it as a reimbursable expense in the concession agreement or by charging a warehousing/service fee that covers the insurance?

 

@Alexandre Cachecho <mailto:Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com>  are you OK with Hagop’s feedback?

 

Best,

Dana

From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
Sent: Thursday, 22 May 2025 3:44 PM
To: Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com>; Mohammed El Neel <Mohammed.Elneel@chalhoub.com>
Cc: Sara Rebeiz <Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com>; Alexandre Cachecho <Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com>
Subject: Re: Level Shoes Al Quoz Warehouse

 

Hi Dana,

 

We can cover stock held in consignment but we need to declare the stock value and pay the relevant premium.

metadata.doc_id: CXZTJOB - level shoes al quoz warehouse\Conversation.txt
metadata.doc_path: C:\Users\ASUS\Desktop\Outlook\CXZTJOB - level shoes al quoz warehouse\Conversation.txt

chunks.text:
From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
Sent: Thursday, 22 May 2025 3:44 PM
To: Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com>; Mohammed El Neel <Mohammed.Elneel@chalhoub.com>
Cc: Sara Rebeiz <Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com>; Alexandre Cachecho <Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com>
Subject: Re: Level Shoes Al Quoz Warehouse

 

Hi Dana,

 

We can cover stock held in consignment but we need to declare the stock value and pay the relevant premium.

 

Also, the contract with the consignor, we need to have it mentioned that we are responsible for losses to the products whilst in our possession and the basis of compensation as the insurance will follow the underlying contract when settling the claim.

 

The framework is in place that we can cover goods in trust. However, in order to do so, we need to declare the value of stock held in trust and pay additional premium.

 

Let me know if you need any further information.


Best Regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

+971 4 8045000

From: Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com <mailto:Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com> >
Sent: Thursday, May 22, 2025 4:09 PM
To: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> >; Alexandre Cachecho <Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com <mailto:Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Sara Rebeiz <Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com <mailto:Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com> >; Mohammed El Neel <Mohammed.Elneel@chalhoub.com <mailto:Mohammed.Elneel@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: RE: Level Shoes Al Quoz Warehouse

 

Hi Hagop,

 

Thanks for the breakdown.

 

For context, this is our standard concession agreement, and the insurance terms are outlined on page 17. If the brand accepts this concession agreement with those insurance terms as-is, are we sufficiently covered? Or would we need to incorporate additional language to address the below—specifically that the goods are held in trust and premium has been paid? How long would this take with the insurer?

 

Also, is there a way to pass this premium cost back to the brand, either by including it as a reimbursable expense in the concession agreement or by charging a warehousing/service fee that covers the insurance?

 

@Alexandre Cachecho <mailto:Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com>  are you OK with Hagop’s feedback?

 

Best,

Dana

From: Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com <mailto:Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com> >
Sent: Thursday, 22 May 2025 3:44 PM
To: Dana Mahdi <Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com <mailto:Dana.Mahdi@chalhoub.com> >; Mohammed El Neel <Mohammed.Elneel@chalhoub.com <mailto:Mohammed.Elneel@chalhoub.com> >
Cc: Sara Rebeiz <Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com <mailto:Sara.Rebeiz@chalhoub.com> >; Alexandre Cachecho <Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com <mailto:Alexandre.Cachecho@chalhoub.com> >
Subject: Re: Level Shoes Al Quoz Warehouse

 

Hi Dana,

 

We can cover stock held in consignment but we need to declare the stock value and pay the relevant premium.

 

Also, the contract with the consignor, we need to have it mentioned that we are responsible for losses to the products whilst in our possession and the basis of compensation as the insurance will follow the underlying contract when settling the claim.

 

The framework is in place that we can cover goods in trust. However, in order to do so, we need to declare the value of stock held in trust and pay additional premium.

 

Let me know if you need any further information.


Best Regards,

Hagop

 

HAGOP GHAZARIAN

SPECIALIST ‑ ADMINISTRATION

M.C.T. FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES
